text:
The ability to change the port number that you are running watchdog on from the
prompt doesn't work.  The documentation says that when you run watchdog you can
type:

ant -dport=#### <test-type>

to change from the default port 8080 to the specified port #.  However, this
doesn't work at all.  The test still runs using port 8080.  If you fo into the
different config xml files and change the default port # to the desired port #,
then it works.
creator: russell@quadrix.com

text:
This works OK for me.

Below is output confirming this.  I've directed GTest to use port 8000 where
I have another server instance listening, but the test apps are not deployed:

-> ant -Dport=8000 jsp
Buildfile: build.xml

jsp:

execute:
     [java] Buildfile: conf/jsp-gtest.xml
     [java] 
     [java] jsp-test:
     [java]     [gtest]  Error in: GET
/jsp-tests/jsp/misc/precompilation/precompile.jsp?jsp_precompile HTTP/1.0
     [java]     [gtest]     Expected Status-Line with one or all of the
following values:
     [java]     [gtest]     Status-Code: 200
     [java]     [gtest]     Reason-Phrase: 
     [java]     [gtest]     Received: HTTP/1.1 404
/jsp-tests/jsp/misc/precompilation/precompile.jsp

I'll mark this as WORKSFORME.  If this is still an issue with the latest builds,
please reopen the bug.
creator: Ryan.Lubke@Sun.COM
